cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.GR, cs.GT, cs.SG. 

The paper deals with unfolding convex polyhedra, which is a classic problem in computational geometry. The use of quasigeodesic loops is a novel approach to this problem, and is likely to be of interest to researchers in computational geometry (cs.CG). The paper also involves cutting shortest paths from vertices, which is a common technique in data structures (cs.DS). The concept of star unfolding is related to graph theory and planar graphs, which falls under the category of graph theory (cs.GT) and planar graph algorithms (cs.SG). Finally, the paper involves geometric algorithms and optimization, which could potentially fall under the category of computational geometry (cs.CG) or geometric optimization (cs.GR).
